result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Reginald Anthony Sanford

records.addlTxt: Defense Motion in Limine, filed.
filed.
Defendant's Proposed Jury Instructions, filed.
Filed: Original Transcript of Preliminary Hearing ( 12 pages) commencing 09-26-2022 by Debra A. Wisniewski .
State's Motion In Limine, filed.
filed.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Reginald Anthony Sanford.  Prosecuting attorney Michelle A. Grasso in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court on defense motion to modify bail.  Arguments heard. Court DENIED defense motion to modify bail.  Defendant has entered a speedy trial demand.
Defense is requesting final pretrial and jury trial dates. Case is adjourned to 11-8-22 at 8:30 am for final pretrial and 12-12-22 at 8:30 am for jury trial.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 8, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Notice of Expert Testimony, filed.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.  Exp 12/27/2022

CASE HEARD IN PRELIM FOR BR 10:
Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Reginald Anthony Sanford.  Prosecuting attorney Thomas Hasle in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: South Milwaukee Investigator N. Siefert. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for October 4, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, in custody.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Reginald Anthony Sanford.  Prosecuting attorney Jacob A. Maule in court for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for Status of Counsel hearing. Discussion with parties. Attorney Domask informs court that he was recently appointed, and requests case be set for a preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to prelim court.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 26, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel
Received and Filed. SPD Order Appointing Counsel

Attorney Thomas R. Reed in court, defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, in custody.  Michelle A. Grasso appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for State v Lee hearing. All parties appeared via zoom. Defendant not produced. Attorney Reed provides an update to the court. Court finds cause to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Status conference scheduled for September 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, defendant in custody. Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for cause to the trial court for a State V. Lee Hearing.  Hearing scheduled for August 15, 2022 at 08:30 am.
OSPD Appointment of Counsel Report, filed.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, defendant in custody. Gregg Herman appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing or status; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford not in court, defendant in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be sent to the trial court for a State V. Lee hearing; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered no contact with S.R.D.
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Reginald Anthony Sanford in custody.  Constatine Siapkaris appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Reginald Anthony Sanford appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Havas, Branch 10.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL. Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4). This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 23, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
